meanings.definition: Relating to bodily fluids, especially blood.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the humoral imbalance in his blood needed to be corrected.
meanings.sent2: The humoral test results showed high levels of glucose in his blood.
meanings.sent3: His humoral blood test results were so extreme that they seemed like a science fiction plot.
meanings.sent4: The humoral flow of blood through his veins was like a river rushing through a canyon.
meanings.sent5: She visualized the humoral nature of blood as a vibrant red river flowing inside her body.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or pertaining to the four humors of ancient physiology.
meanings.sent1: The play depicted a humoral character who embodied the traits of melancholy.
meanings.sent2: In ancient medicine, the humoral theory classified personalities based on four humors.
meanings.sent3: His humoral personality made him the perfect fit for the role of the jester.
meanings.sent4: The humoral balance of the characters in the story created a harmonious narrative.
meanings.sent5: The humoral essence of the protagonist shone through his actions and words.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the immune system.
meanings.sent1: The humoral response of his immune system was swift in fighting off the infection.
meanings.sent2: Vaccines work by triggering a humoral immune response in the body.
meanings.sent3: His humoral immunity was so strong that he rarely fell ill.
meanings.sent4: The humoral defense mechanism of the body acted like an army protecting against invaders.
meanings.sent5: She imagined her humoral shield guarding her against any harmful pathogens.
